1) Find $\frac{dy}{dx}$ for 

$$x^3+y^3=3xy$$


2) Find the equation of the tangent line $L(X)$ at the point the above curve at the point $\left(\frac{3}{2},\frac{3}{2}\right)$


3) Find $\frac{dy}{dx}$, and also all coordinates where the curve has a vertical tangent:

$$x=\frac{1}{3}y^3-\frac{1}{2}y^2-6y$$

4)  Find $\frac{dy}{dx}$ for 

$$6x^2y^2+\sin(xy)=2x$$
